description: Buy the Castelli Tutto Nano Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tutto Nano Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Tutto Nano Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've had a pair and used them all last winter in temps from low 40s to low 60s.  You have to adjust the other stuff as temps rise and fall but these shorts were great in that range.  I pair with knee warners for upper 50s to upper 60s.  I pair with leg warmers when temps won't exceed 60.  They might be ok lower than low 40s but I never used them below maybe 40F and it warmed up that day to high 40s.  I routinely ride 3.5 hours on them and have no issue with the chamois. I'm going to order another pair (and another pair of leg warmers) so I don't have to do laundry as often. 
I tried hard to determine if the material was different than the Nano Flex Pro, and I think it's the same but the legs just have a slightly different cut, and the NFP is designed around racing and warmth further down the thigh.  When you're wearing knee or leg warmers, I think the tutto nano are probably the better choice. YMMV.

Oh, I have sprinters legs:  5'10", 181 lbs and 24 inch thighs. I wear a L in Castelli tops and XXL in shorts (yes, double XL).  Go figure.
review.name: Great from low 40s to low 60s F

review.reviewBody: These are great bibs for when a bib-tight is too much. For example, when the morning starts off mid-to-low 50s, but is expected to reach mid-60s to low-70s by the afternoon. There is a thin layer of fleece insulation to keep you warm and the chamois is super comfy. Like the Tutto Nano jersey, the bibs are not waterproof; they will resist a light misting, but that's about it. I bought a large and it fits perfect -- tight but non-restrictive.
review.name: Great for transitional weather

name: Tutto Nano Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: The size chart did not work.  Simms does not take ladies into account when they make products.  Other brands of waders I've had in the past have adjustable chest and waste cinches.  Not that case here. These waders are hideous, I might be better off wearing a trash bag.
Great wader.  My wife loves these waders, big enough in the hips were she can still move in and out of creeks easily.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
Believe your sizes are way off. Originally ordered standard size for my wife based upon your AI sizing. Way off. Had to return regular and exchange for short. My wife is 5’6” and they are still too long, but the best we can get. 
I’m sure quality is exceptional, as always.
review.name: Be sure to try on before purchase!!

review.reviewBody: These waders are bomb proof - I got them at the end of the season and they withstood some insane weather, kept me warm in a hail storm, and are cut perfectly for a normal woman's body - nothing too tight and no ballooning (thanks Simms design team!). I also cannot believe the quality and durability for the price! If you are just getting into fishing or you've been fishing for longer than you can remember, you'll be psyched to have a pair of these in your truck.
review.name: Rain, Hail, Toddler Proof and fit perfectly!

name: Freestone Stockingfoot Wader - Women's

review.reviewBody: Best boots I have ever purchased.  Wife is going to enjoy all my future Redwing purchases.
review.name: Iron Rangers

review.reviewBody: I did a lot of research on which boots to buy, and these kept coming up. I love the attention to detail and the features in this boot. I also love the fact that my toes aren’t cramped anymore. If you were on the fence before, I wouldn’t hesitate if your sizes in stock
review.name: Everything I wanted it to be.

review.reviewBody: I have had this boot for a little over a year now. It has held up great. I plan on purchasing them in a black or suede color. The break in period was a little rough (about a week) but they are easily on my top 3 most comfortable boots I have ever worn.
review.name: My Favorite Set of Boots

review.reviewBody: Awesome boots. Copper Rough and Tough leather is amazing. Wear a size 9 in the 1907 Moc toe……8.5 in the ranger…..perfect fit! If you wear boots for a living, the break in is no problem, just put them on and go!
review.name: Classic, well made boot.

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these boots.  They look as good in real life as they do in the photos.  I had previously owned two pairs of 1907s in a size 9 which fit perfectly, so I assumed a size 9 in the 8083s would too.  When I laced them up for the first time, I could hardly spread my toes and my foot felt very squeezed.  I figured this might be because they were brand new and just needed some breaking in.  But after a few months and I had to stop wearing them because they were literally cutting off circulation in my toes, causing them to tingle.  These feel WAY MORE TIGHT and NARROW than the 1907s.  Wish I had tried them on in a store before purchasing online.  I'm still a fan of the brand/craftsmanship, but I'll be avoiding Iron Rangers.
review.name: Quality Build, Poor Fit
comment: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots.   An email was sent to explain how we may be able to assist you with this issue.  Thank you.

review.reviewBody: The craftsmanship of these boots are absolutely amazing I’ve been wearing mine everyday for work, hiking,Church and yard work averaging 20 thousand steps a day it is exactly what I was looking for in a boot a boot that I can work in and brush off and go to church in i highly recommend these boots to anyone who wants a high quality heritage boot that can do anything you throw at it
review.name: SUPERB BOOTS
comment: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review on one of our products. We appreciate the honesty and are happy to hear you would recommend this boot.  Have a great day and thank you again for leaving your feedback!

review.reviewBody: Been wearing same pair of boots for several years. Time to Buy the same pair again.
review.name: Great Boots
comment: Thanks for reaching out to let us know how the Iron Rangers have served you well! We hope you continue to enjoy the footwear and let us know if you need anything!

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality, fit, and style. Fit great (although stiff as expected when new). Within a week of daily wear, they now fit like a glove. I dont buy small or snug. I buy what fits, a d they get better from there.
review.name: My daily boots!
comment: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review on one of our products. We appreciate the honesty and are happy to hear you would recommend this boot.  Have a great day and thank you again for leaving your feedback!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had my iron rangers over two years. I wear  them 5-6 days per week. Just had a cobbler replace the soles last week.  I’ll contest to saying these boots fit any situation!
review.name: The perfect boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue serving you long into the future!

review.reviewBody:
The break in on this boot is definitely one of the gnarliest compared to other boots I own. However putting some moleskin on the areas I was getting boot smooches made it bearable. I don't typically condition boots right when I get them, but after about a week I slapped some Bick 4 on them to help the process along. Once the boots were sufficiently worn though, they did became immensely comfortable; like an extension of my foot. 

The quality and QC on the Iron Rangers is absolutely better than some of the other heritage style boots I walk around in. Overall I am very happy with my purchase and know these boots will be in my rotation for many years to come.
review.name: Excellent boots!
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. Thanks for the tips and tricks on making that a bit easier! We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

name: 6in Iron Ranger Wide Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: This was a great purchase for my Hawaii trip. Great in the water and walking in rocks. Comfortable and easy to clean up.

review.reviewBody: This shoe fits great on my foot. comfortable and durable. easy to get on and off with the buckle. I did get a mild blister on the back of 1 of my heels, but that is pretty standard for new, durable sandals.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: I bought these because of the snap closure and toe protection. I bought these in spite of the plastic insole which always leaves my feet sweaty.
review.name: This is my second purchase

review.reviewBody: This is the 2nd pair. It feels great so far and i expect it will last as long as the first pair, which I'm still trying to wear out. This was my 1st online purchase. I never saw the 10% discount for a first time purchase.
review.name: I would buy this product again but the 10% discount would ni

review.reviewBody: Wear every day, all day. These would have been my third pair of these sandals. First two were wonderful and were worn completely out. This pair was supposedly EXACTLY THE SAME SIZE AND COLOUR. The new left one is a bit snugger than the old left one. The right one is so tight it is actually painful. I've already recycled the box and worn them outside so I guess I'm stuck with a pair of Tevas that cannot be worn. Back to the second pair...
review.name: Very poor fit compared to the previous two pairs I've owned.

review.reviewBody: The arch and heel straps make for a secure fit and they look good too.
review.name: Functional and attractive

review.reviewBody: Daily knock around sandal. Good support for recovering knee.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Ordered 9.5 seems not true to size. A bit tight. Toe box is a little narrow Looks like I am stuck
review.name: Maybe I would buy again in a large size

review.reviewBody: really like the shoe....its a bit tight at first but after about 2 days they broke in pretty good. Great for me, I hate wearing socks in the summer if I dont have to, but I really dont like open toe sandals. These are perfect for me
review.name: No need to wear socks in the Spring and the summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit is Amazing and True to Size. I did have another pair of XL 686 gloves that seemed a bit large l, but these fit perfect. They do feel like they will keep me warm in those teens to single digit days for sure.
review.name: 2nd pair of Mitt’z

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Whats not to love? Soft on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Hand melts in the glove, not in your mouth.
review.name: No Glove, No love

review.reviewBody: Ordered a size Large and once on they fit perfectly around the hand but they are very tight getting the hand in past the wrist. I loved the mittens themselves but they were just too tight getting in. Also, wearing a watch under them would be very difficult.
review.name: Really wanted to like these mittens.

review.reviewBody: Under cuff is my fav! Black in color to match everything. Super warm and comfy on a cold night riding.
review.name: Super nice mitts!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These mittens were great. As someone who is usually a gloves guy, I tried mittens for the first time with these and absolutely loved them. My hands stayed warm both days I was out (even too warm at times, which bodes well for when i eventually have a very cold day). Plus the waterproofing worked great, and I enjoyed the wriststraps so I could take them off easily when I got too warm. 100% recommend
review.name: Incredibly warm and definitely waterproof!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and I really like the inner lining has separation for my fingers.Well made and warm.
review.name: Great Mitt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for cold days, and fits comfortably under your sleeves.
review.name: Great for cold days, and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don’t know if there’s a better value mitt. They have GORE-TEX, are insulated, and have finger-seperated linings. I don’t ride the tow rope much these days but wouldn’t expect any mitt to survive the beatings there so I don’t really consider tow rope durability. True to size and under cuff design is nice! Overall love that I purchased!
review.name: Great value mitt!

review.reviewBody: These MITs are freaking toasty. Love the warm dividers between the fingers!! Medium is a little snug prob should have gone large. Guess I’ll have to order a second set and hand these down to a kid!
review.name: Toasty mittens

review.reviewBody: These mittens are warm, dry and waterproof! Got to love the black on grey too
review.name: Awesome

name: Linear Gore-Tex Under Cuff Mitten

review.itemreviewed: Shift Pro 90 Alpine Touring Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have three pairs of Salamon boots so I purchased these confidently. Unfortunately they are not as comfortable as my other ones. The foot part fits very well and I like the slim metal buckles. However, after a couple of runs my shins hurt bad no matter how I adjust the strap and buckles. It could be because of the shape of the padding or not thick enough. It's frustrating that it is hard to know without actually skiing in them.
review.name: Not the most comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Shift Pro 90 Alpine Touring Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these boots as a Christmas present and they are the most uncomfortable ski boots I have ever stepped into. I was fitted for them both before and after purchasing them, and was told by my local ski shop that I purchased the correct size. I’m not sure why, but the way they fit seems to completely restrict circulation to my feet, causing my toes to become painfully cold and numb within the first 15 minutes of strapping them on. I have skied in them over 20 times now hoping to “break them in” but have had no luck improving the comfort of the boots. Overall, would not recommend these boots to anyone.
review.name: Painfully uncomfortable
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Broader shoulder fella here, my wife purchased these for me since they have the expandable sides. These fit excellent. I’m a true XL, but with the stretch in these the L work great.
review.name: Great fit and design

review.reviewBody: I am 6’ 140lbs girl, I ordered the men’s small, because I was hoping for a longer torso and leg! They are super comfy narrow in the hip but SUPER SHORT, I am keeping them tho, I will let the hem out at the bottom thank gosh they have about a 1.5” hem.
review.name: These are awesome but short!

review.reviewBody:
These are some of my favorite pants I own. First ones I go for once the laundry is done! Not sure what the other reviewer is talking about regarding the corduroy feeling thin, mine are plenty thick and nice and warm for the winter. Didnt think corduroy was supposed to be a tough fabric, I wear it when Im looking for comfort and warmth. 

 I am a fan of the elastic straps, they are very comfortable on the shoulders. If there is one complaint I have its that the hook/loop attachment is rather tight so it is hard to unbuckle the straps. Not an issue for me though as I never really undo them anyway, the side zip gives enough entry ease as-is.
review.name: Favorite Pants

review.reviewBody: They are not well made. The fabric is stretchy but not strong. It is not real tough corderoy it is a stretchy light version of it. The straps are elastic and don't latch easily. They were disappointing and cheaply made.
review.name: Poor Quality

name: Corduroy Overall - Men's

hasVariant.name: Carbon Probe 280 Speed Lock
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Carbon Probe 280 Speed Lock online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Industry leading probe for a reason. Good depth for PNW snow
I would absolutely love this item if it had a traditional pull style locking mechanism. I use it for ski patrolling, and I just find it as a bit more inconvenient to use the current system.
Much sturdier than some of the other aluminum probes on the market, easy to use and quick to deploy. Had no issues when using it to probe for beacons during practice rescues.
review.name: Very solid probe

review.reviewBody: Light weight probe that's easily assembled as well as stached in a backpack.
Works great. Would recommend aluminum as shoveling close to a carbon probe may result in potential damage.
I think this stuff is very well engineered and light weight.
review.name: Carbon Probe

review.reviewBody: Probe deploys quickly and easily, eliminating one distracting complication in times of high stress and mandatory execution.
Lightweight to carry and smooth locking to deploy.
review.name: Quick to deploy

review.reviewBody: Thankfully I haven't had any cause to use the probe outside of practicing or within the class, but it deploys quickly and probes deeply which is what you want to happen in situations where it's needed.
review.name: Locks in place and starts poking fast!

review.reviewBody: I've been practicing beacon finding and this probe deploys quickly and easily.
review.name: A great lightweight probe.

name: Carbon Probe 280 Speed Lock

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these several months ago and couldn’t be happier. I’m 5’10, 150lbs and wear the Large. The compression in the thigh is high but that what makes them so great. They fit like a glove without digging into my mom belly. The big part is stretchy and comfortable, too. Although I do wish they were a tad longer because the straps dig in a tad bit but I get some relief adjusting ever so often.
review.name: Problem solved

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am 5’3, 140# and the M fit PERFECT. everything about these shorts feels great except the desert mauve (pink color) is totally see through. Stick to the darker colors unless you want everyone within a 10mi radius to see more than they bargained for!
review.name: See through

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
THE TAKEAWAY: I returned these for a bigger size. Not sure why these are designed for wiry teen boys?? 

I'm not very "curvy," but do have biking muscles, which made it hard to squeeze into these. Felt discouraged so decided to return them for something entirely different instead of sizing up, in large part because these were no longer on sale.

Size up! You deserve it!
review.name: Too small!

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'6", usually wear a size 24/25 or 00/0 pant, 105 lbs. I bought these in XS and love them.  They are my daily bibs for short weekday and longer weekend rides. I would say they are true to size.

They are just the right amount of compression to make it feel like you're wearing a high quality pair of bibs but not sausage-ing your legs into them. The bigger/wider cuff on the bottom stays put, the bib straps are wide enough to not cut in or be uncomfortable.

I bought 2 pairs of these and crashed in a pair. They don't say anything about 'crash resistance' fabric, but the leg panels definitely kept me from getting too road rashed. Will certainly be buying another pair!
review.name: Great for a serious rider!

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
the fit around the butt area was way too tight, creating the padding to be off kilter. The top straps were very light though personally would prefer more tension on them. 

5'4, 140lbs, bigger ba-donk
review.name: Medium still too small for bigger bums

name: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short  - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love this top. It is so comfortable. It fits so well and I keep getting many compliments on it. I first bought the lighter color at a store and loved it so much. I decided to get the darker online. Both of them are stunning and ever so functional.
review.name: Woman's echo, printed hoodie

review.reviewBody: Great color, nice weight, easy to wash while traveling. Packs well.
review.name: Nice light hoodie

review.reviewBody:
I like the material and the color (I got the blue one).
It's thin, feels nice in summer.
However, the hoodie is too small, so it doesn't block as much sun as I hoped. It doesn't fit over my cap.
review.name: nice material, hoodie is too small

review.reviewBody: I have never gotten more compliments on a shirt in my life. I did a summit hike in it yesterday and was stopped 3 separate times to take about it. It's thin, I felt fully protected from the sun, and it kept me cool. The thumb and ponytail holes are also a total game changer.
review.name: Thin, protective, and so cute!!

review.reviewBody: This hoodie is everything I was hoping it would be! It's so lightweight and comfortable. Perfect for kayaking and summer hiking!
review.name: Great Gear!

review.reviewBody: I like the bold print which camouflages the transparent nature of the fabric. I got my favorite color scheme which is the "snow watercolor". My size small printed hoodie seems to fit more generously than another Echo shirt I recently bought in size small (the half-zip one) and I like the more relaxed fit. For reference I'm 5'3", 127. Excellent for running, hiking and casual use in hot sunny weather. The thumb loops for keeping my hands covered are great. I prefer wearing a light sun shirt with long sleeves over having to keep reapplying sunscreen. The Echo line of shirts is as good as it gets for extreme lightweight, breathable fabric.
review.name: Go-To Shirt For Hot Sunny Days

review.reviewBody: I bought one a few months ago because I wanted more sun protection when I hike and backpack. What sold me on this one was the pony tail slit in the hood!! I couldn’t believe somebody finally did this! I was going to pay someone to put a slit in the back of another sun hoodie I own. Another plus is that it is so lightweight. I loved it so much I bought another one.
review.name: The Best Sun Hoodie

review.reviewBody: I love these summer sun shirts. I work in the field throughout the summer and first bought one of these for the added sun protection and light feel. It has been one of my absolute favourites...I have since ordered several more. Great when working in the forest or out in the sun. I love it for biking, hiking, and more. True to size - I wear both small and medium depending on how much room I want.
review.name: Perfect summer shirt.

review.reviewBody: I've tried most of the sun hoodies available from Backcountry and REI, and this one was my favorite. Flattering (aka not too tight on my belly fat - I'm 5'6 with lots of curves and got the XL). Their lavender color is see through but the blue camo is not, and is super pretty (and won't look dirty in 5 seconds...). Note though that if I trusted the measurements there was no way my waist would be good in that XL, it would have been more of a 1X, but then that would have been way too large...
review.name: Lower UV protection but lightest ever

review.reviewBody: Great quality and functionality!!
review.name: Excellent!!

name: Echo Printed Hoodie - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Nytro E7 Ultegra Di2 Carbon Wheel Road E-Bike
review.reviewBody:
I purchased a Pinarello E-bike on Backcountry for my wife.  The transaction processing was clear and easy.  Shipping was prompt;  That is the end of the positives.  The bike arrived but without the Owner's manuel and other instructions on how to assemble.  Installing the seat post on this bike is differect from most; instructions not sent.  I contacted Backcountry customer support.  They apologized and the individual emailed me the owners manuel and several 'dealer technical manuels' on Di shifting.  The bike arrived without the appropirate manuels;  no instructions on use of the App; the pedal assist settings were not properly configured; the disc brakes needed adjusting and the Ultegra shifting didn't work.  Customer assistance was worthless.  We have figured out and corrected these problems w assistance from various bike shops.
     I absolutely will never purchase another bike from Backcountry or Competitive Cyclist (their sister company).  There is no functional customer assistance.  If this were a ordinary bike; I could have easily addressed the poor quality of the bike's shipped setup.  However, this is a pedal assist e-bike and  substantially more complicated.  
   I would never recommend Backcountry to purchase a bike or any complicated product.  Go to your local/regional bike store where you can get quality customer support..
    I do not recommend Backcountry.
review.name: Worthless customer support

name: Nytro E7 Ultegra Di2 Carbon Wheel Road E-Bike

review.reviewBody: Love all of my Keens! Comfortable, tough and long lasting.
review.name: AWESOME!

review.reviewBody: Good durable shoes that I used on my 13 mile strenuous hike. However the tip of tongue and eyelet dug into the top of my foot painfully the entire way through my hike leaving a welt afterwards, super disappointing. The other shoe was perfectly fine.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like these shoes. Years ago I had some low top Hi-Tech hiking shoes. Had not been able to find anything remotely similar. Now I got these. Far superior and a better looking shoe.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing the Targhee slip on for the past couple years and needed a gortex shoe. I figured it would be a very similar midsole but it's not. There is very little cushion. I wore them for one trip to the store
review.name: Not comfortable

review.reviewBody: Ordered this pair of Keens and it took two weeks to receive them. Second time wearing them, the stitching that holds the lace attachment broke. Now I have a pair of Keens that Backcountry won't accept back because they were worn (brought them to the store and was turned away and directed to Keens warranty). And because Backcountry took 2 weeks to ship them, they are outside of Keens 30-day return window. Hoping to get some sort of credit for these defective shoes from Keens but they don't list Backcountry as an authorized seller on their drop-down list for warranty.
review.name: Won't buy from Backcountry again

review.reviewBody: The shoe is terrific but the ones I have had before did not last nearly as longas I had hoped for.
review.name: Good shoe/questionable lifespan

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've worn Keens since around 2008. Many, many pairs from work boots to comfy shoes, including previous versions of Targhees. Obviously, I've been a fan. I've been wearing this pair of Targhee IVs for a couple weeks, and I hate them. They're ridiculously heavy. They're stiff. And I'm disappointed I spent money on them. It does look like they won't fall apart, so that's great. But there's little chance of them falling apart when they'll only be sitting in the bottom of the closet. Anybody need a size 14? I'll send them to you.
review.name: Stiff, heavy, clunky

review.reviewBody: These shoes are incredible. Huge step up from the older model.
review.name: High quality

review.reviewBody:
Love the Targhee
Had three pair separate the sole.
Still love them!!
Hope this redesign fixes thst issue.
review.name: Glad they rededigned the sole

review.reviewBody: Stylish for casual wear and comfortable (love Keens for the rounded (generous) toe area)).
review.name: Stylish & Comfortable

name: Targhee IV WP Hiking Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this jacket!! I recently moved from the west coast to the mid-west, and the cold winters have been a huge adjustment. I definitely did not have a proper winter jacket for this type of weather. I looked all over at local department stores and couldn’t find what I wanted. I was looking for a stylish, warm, functional jacket. This was it. I ordered this jacket online and have been so pleased with the purchase. First, the jacket looks exactly as it shows on the website. I used the size guide and based upon the recommendation, the size fits me like a glove. This jacket is beyond warm. No more wind blowing into my sleeves or up through the bottom of the jacket. The material deflects rain, keeping me dry in these crazy storms. There is a drawstring to tighten the jacket at the waist, creating a fitted look and added warmth. The gold liner definitely does its job keeping in the heat. The hood when pulled up covers exactly enough of my head so that if I am walking in the wind, it doesn’t catch the wind and blow back. There are a ton of pockets that are thoughtfully placed for easy access. I just cannot say enough about this jacket. It was worth every dollar spent. I have even convinced two coworkers to buy one. The quality of this jacket has shown me the importance of proper winter gear. Highly recommend.
review.name: I needed this! Highly recommend!

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is extremely warm, comfortable and it looks great. I like the fur on the hoodies. Big pockets are always a big plus too!
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just as advertised, nice quality and fit. Although I haver gotten a chance to wear it yet I am excited to.  I tried it on and it fits great and it's so comfortable.
review.name: Love it.

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm!!! Perfect for snowy days. Great coat to be outside in 20 degree or less weather.
review.name: Warm!!!

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is extremely nice. It is heavy and even the arms seem insulated enough which you sometimes don't see. It is a lot nicer than my previous coat from a different outdoor retailer. The sleeves are kind of small compared to my last jacket but I think it is due to the insulation and it is not uncomforable. In fact I feel more mobile in this jacket than my last. I am 5'5 and it is pretty long but that is okay, I want to stay warm so long is what I want. It doesn't seem to restrict movement.
Two things about the shape are odd but not dealbreakers.
The hood w/ the fur on is really large and flops over into my face even though I have a large head. I like that it will keep me warm that way but it isn't great visibilty.
The in line pockets are weird! The angle is hard to get your hands into and I definintely wouldn't carry things in them. They need to be angled a little for more comfort and function. The good news is on top of those there are functional pockets with flaps that snap so you can still put your phone and keys safely in. 
I usually wear between a large and xl and so I got the xl and I am glad I did for layering purposes.
review.name: Nice Parka

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought last year after much research, love all the features. It's waterproof, long, and warm. The little hand warmers are really comfortable and the pockets have a soft lining and flaps to keep water out. Fit is on the large size; I normally wear a medium but the size small fit best.
review.name: Great coat

review.itemreviewed: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect replacement for my old jacket. I love that this has partial hand covering sleeves as this keeps out the cold and the snow. This jacket is stylish, but also super functional.  I ordered a large and I have enough room for a hoody underneath. I can’t wait until it gets colder so I can wear this jacket everyday!
review.name: Amazing

name: Little Si II Insulated Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: Don't buy it, just like others, my tire is going flat directly after install. Leaking through the sidewalls.
review.name: Going flat right away

review.reviewBody: Super grippy. Enduro tire of choice.
review.name: Favorite enduro tires

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed in this tire, I have flatted 4 times in my first 5 rides, and the tire is already starting to crack on the sidewall.
review.name: 4 flats in first 5 rides

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed in this tire, I have flatted 4 times in my first 5 rides, and the tire is already starting to crack on the sidewall.
review.name: 4 flats in first 5 rides

review.reviewBody: I have been riding these tires for just over two years now. Definitely more confidence inspiring than maxxis dhf and dhr ii. It grips better and is more durable than maxxis. It rolls slightly worse but you can carry extra speed in the corners. Casing is also more durable than the exo +. I kept puncturing the exo + casing but have not once punctured the michelin tires where it is not repairable, front or rear. I ride these tires in dry loose trails of socal.
review.name: Can't beat these

review.reviewBody: Bought this tire to replace the Maxxis Rekons on my Scott Spark 950. I have another bike with Schwalbe Magic Mary at front and Hans Dampf at rear and they were great on snow and ice. With more aggressive tire profile, I thought the Wild Enduro would have better grip. I was mistaken big time! This tire doesn’t have any grip on cold, snowy and icy surface. I had to deflate the tire to around 15psi ( i’m 5’11”, 185lbs) in order for it to have at least some grip, and even with that pressure, I had to be really slow otherwise i would have slid all over the place. I had to walk my bike on descents as I would have definitely crashed going down. This tire might be good for tropical weather, but definitely not for the cold north.
review.name: Not for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Bought this tire to replace the Maxxis Rekons on my Scott Spark 950. I have another bike with Schwalbe Magic Mary at front and Hans Dampf at rear and they were great on snow and ice. With more aggressive tire profile, I thought the Wild Enduro would have better grip. I was mistaken big time! This tire doesn’t have any grip on cold, snowy and icy surface. I had to deflate the tire to around 15psi ( i’m 5’11”, 185lbs) in order for it to have at least some grip, and even with that pressure, I had to be really slow otherwise i would have slid all over the place. I had to walk my bike on descents as I would have definitely crashed going down. This tire might be good for tropical weather, but definitely not for the cold north.
review.name: Not for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Covers moon dust to deep mud with competence and no problem areas where it doesn't work. While an Assegai w/Maxxgrip may beat it in the moon dust by a small amount, it weighs about 400g more. A dedicated mud-spike will also be better in the mud. But nothing beats the Wild Enduro as a tire that performs at the highest levels EVERYWHERE. IMO, this is the best tire ever made for the front end of a mt bike.   Rolling resistance is great for what it is, but not great if you compare it to an xc race tire, so it get 3 stars there, but it does roll faster than many other DH type tires so it gets one star back. Hard to judge this one...
review.name: Most Versatile Front Tire Ever

review.reviewBody: Have been running the Wild Enduro Front Magi-X and Wild Enduro Rear GUM-X3D for almost 4 months now and they have been some of the best cornering and root gripping tires that I have owned. Hands down better than the Maxxis Minion DHF and DHR combo that I had on previously. Would buy these again.
review.name: Excellent grip and low rolling resistance

review.reviewBody: Really good on most terrains unless its super GLOOPY muddy. Light enough to make it up all the climbs, strong enough for most descents. I have run these on the rear, but for rougher faster uplifted style terrain such as bike parks they are not quite strong enough and have torn them. I run these front and rear all year in the UK and just change them for alps holidays
review.name: Perfect for most uk riding

name: Wild Enduro Tire - 27.5in

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I only buy and wear ExOfficio underwear, because it's so comfortable and doesn't ride up or feel tight.  It's my all-time favorite underwear.
review.name: Ultimate Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I do a lot of exercise and sweat a lot and these breathe and dry quickly!
review.name: Best underwear ever’

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Before I always word natural fabrics, even when travelling.  But I tried a pair of these bikini briefs, and will never use cotton or silk panties for travelling again.  They are so comfortable, wash and dry amazingly quickly, and are a beautiful blue color.  I love wearing them!
review.name: Best underwear for travelling!

review.itemreviewed: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 Bikini Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product! Very comfortable and stationary. Only complain is elastic in waist and leg bands are showing so wear after less than a year of wear.
review.name: Very comfy and breathable!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight. Easy to move in. Water resistance is fine and a small compromise for the breathability. No insulation. Very thin. 5 stars for backcountry. Probably not as good for wet weather. Skinned and also used at the resort.
review.name: Lightweight. Easy to move in.

review.reviewBody: 3 stars only because these pants fit too big. I got a small, (I’m 5’7” 125lbs) they are about 2 inches too long and the smallest waist adjustment is slightly too big. Other wise these pants are a great lightweight ski pant
review.name: Too Big

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'11", 165lbs, 30" waist, sized into a Small and fit the small size of the dawn patrol kit perfectly. I can't get these to cinch down enough to not fall off my butt, and in classic BD style, there's an overly-inventive belt substitute, but no belt loops! I am looking at having them tailored, but otherwise they'll be going to the resale store.
review.name: Huge waist

review.reviewBody: Excited to try this gear out on the mountain. Build quality and materials seem good. Kind of surprised at how thin it is tho, hopefully it will stand up. No liner or insulation but built into it, but big / loose enough to fit some layers underneath it.
review.name: Mixed feelings

review.reviewBody: More in bounds snowboarder feel than backcountry touring
review.name: Too baggy and loose

review.reviewBody: Looking for a relatively lightweight, flexible, well designed backcountry pants, and these are it!
review.name: Comfortable, bear great for backcountry

review.reviewBody: I have a 35-36” waist and the ladder lock on the large won’t go small enough for me. The hook strap should be at least 1” shorter. The fit is ok in the thigh but bordering on comical below the knee. Could be much tighter and still go over big boots. Hard to imagine that these are much slimmer than the regular Recon unless those are real baggy. Material seems good. Mesh on the vents would be nice.
review.name: Not that slim

review.reviewBody: My pants show little wear at all. Still waterproof. Happy customer
review.name: 4 season coming up

review.reviewBody: The regular Recon Pants have been my workhorse resort pants for several years. Overall I've liked them and they've held up well but the cut is baggier than I need and I thought the LT's trimmer fit and lighter fabric would work better in the backcountry and they definitely do. The LT's are excellent touring friendly hard shells. They don't breathe as well as a soft shell pant but for storm days and colder weather in the backcountry the LTs perform well. My only gripe is the integrated belt has a limited range of adjustability. My 32 waist is within the listed size range for Mediums but in practice the integrated belt ladder lock doesn't let me cinch down enough. Wearing a pack with a waist belt makes this worse. If the pants had belt loops, I'd just use a belt, but they don't. I'm 6' and the length is good for my legs.
review.name: Lightweight,, Belt issue

review.reviewBody: I like these, but they run a bit big and you can’t cinch down the belt past the ladder lock notches. Also, the pants are very long. They’re great, but those two issues are annoying
review.name: I like these, but they

name: Recon LT Stretch Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Shoes look/fit great. Kind of surprised the laces are thinner than some of the Shimano shoes I've tried. 2nd pair of Izumis, great shoes. 

Sizing
I've measured my feet at a shoe store and they're between a 13.5-14 (US), so finding shoes that fit well is kind of a struggle. These fit perfectly for my feet (Sz 49).
review.name: Fits great, can't wait to try them out

review.reviewBody: Lenses are amazing. Very dark and clear. Glasses did not fit my face and did not fit faces of several friends. Not sure if I the pair I got was the intended shape of the maker but I can?t wear them.
review.name: Fit is very strange

review.reviewBody:
Really like the lenses. Frames are light. The retention cord is super helpful (see below) and  appreciated that it came with a carry bag and side shields.

My main complaint is that they slide down my face which I've never had in a pair of glasses. If I'm doing anything active, the retention cord is almost a must. But even in everyday wear, they slide a little. I had hoped once they were broken in, so to speak, that maybe the rubber would get sticker and grip the side of my head better. But still no luck. I would have returned them, but probably worn them too much at this point.
review.name: Great optics, don't love the fit

review.reviewBody: I wear a 2-4, but due to the short length of the belt it is hard to get these over my hips. I wish I had ordered a medium, but don't want to go through the hassle due to backcountry's charge for a return.
review.name: Size up

review.reviewBody:
I was so glad that Backcountry had the Pufferfish gold color and at such an amazing deal!

The material is durable and made from recycled materials! Its doesn't make a swooshing or rubbing sound when walking, and all the pockets are amazing to have! Plus I love the elastic waistband,  that peeks out from the material 

The elastic waistband goes all the way around and its not removable. I didn't realize this until I bought it, but luckily it fits and I can get them on/off no problem. If you have larger hips, I would suggest sizing up, as the elastic waistband is adjustable and could be cinched to fit your waist.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: The belt does not unbuckle, so even though the shorts were loose around my hips, it was a serious struggle to get the waistband over my hips in a size S.  Otherwise, they are really cute and functional.
review.name: Almost impossible to get over hips

review.reviewBody: I bought theses on sale about 6 weeks ago. I really like the color and all of the pockets. Would buy again
review.name: Great Wearing Hiking Shorts

review.reviewBody: I'm usually an x large so I got an x large and they were huge.
review.name: Shorts

review.reviewBody:
I’m 5’4 and around 135 pounds (athletic build) and these shorts are amazing.
I have a larger hips to waist ratio so I got medium. 
The waist band cinches super small so I’m thankful for that or else they’d be too big!
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great, moisture-wicking, but I ordered a medium (my normal size) and they rode up my thighs the entire time.
review.name: Great shorts but not for thick thighs

review.reviewBody: Great shorts, Great fit. Perfect for the beach and hiking. Quick drying. Will definitely get it in more colors.
review.name: Awesome Shorts

review.reviewBody: I love these quick drying and comfortable shorts for hiking and kayaking! I love my 5in baggies and got these to see how they compared and they fit even better and have tons of storage!
review.name: Love these shorts for water sports!

review.reviewBody: Was so excited about these shorts, but I almost couldn't get the small over my hips with the belt fully extended. Once I got them on, they weren't very flattering and the coral was much brighter in real life than I expected.
review.name: barely fit over hips

name: Outdoor Everyday Short - Women's

hasVariant.name: Vantage Endless Promise 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vantage Endless Promise 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vantage Endless Promise 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vantage Endless Promise 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is very well designed and built Backpack! Perfect for my needs! Going 3 days trip! Done! Going few days camping! Perfect! Wish few things are better! Side pockets are ok can fit my Stanley Titanium bottle but then you can't fit nothing inside the pocket! And if they add some straps underneath the backpack so you can attach tarp or jacket, would add even more to this Backpack! Definitely my favorite! Great job
review.name: Hands down, Amazing

review.reviewBody: This is an interesting hybrid between a duffel bag and a backpack.  It has plenty of space for packing.  Seems very well made.  The water bottle pockets are pretty small and wouldn't fit a standard diameter water bottle like a nalgene which is my biggest gripe.  Very comfortable.  Really excited to use this pack.
review.name: Interesting and Inovative

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for commuting to school. The main pocket gives me room for a laptop and tablet, with space for a charger in the small zipper pocket. The duffle style pocket gives me room for my over-ear headphones, a water bottle, and a set of gym clothes. The organization of the pack makes it easy to stay on campus all day, and gives me plenty of versatility. I've also used this bag for a couple of weekend trips. It is a little too small to pack two changes of clothes in colder weather, but I've just brought a small tote to carry anything this pack doesn't fit. The straps are super comfortable and much better than my previous backpack. My only criticisms are the high price point, and the very skinny mesh pockets on the outside that only fit a small number of water bottles. Overall I would absolutely recommend this bag and I believe it will hold up for many years to come.
review.name: Great commuter bag with space for weekend trips

review.reviewBody: Overall, this is a high-quality pack. It will be perfect as a carry-on as I can keep my technology, clothes, and snacks organized and packed efficiently. I do wish the main compartment were a little bit larger as one pair of shoes takes up a lot of space. I also wish there were another way to access the main compartment, example a zipper across the top. I don’t always want to open the pack in a duffel bag manner. The materials used are very high-quality, including the zippers and on the whole I really like the bag.
review.name: Great Quality Pack

review.reviewBody: Truly a great product. There are only two gripes I have. The smaller one is the lack of a hip belt strap. Not a huge deal since overall it carries weight very well, but a hip belt strap would've made it that much better. My bigger complaint is the lack of a water bottle pocket big enough to carry a wide nalgene. None of my water bottles are thin enough for the water bottle pockets and I end up having to store them in my pack.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Was naturally very curious when Nemo released a a line of backpacks. I have to say the padding is extremely comfortable in this, and the clamshell opening is great. I wish the top accessory pocket was a tad bit bigger, and I feel like they could have made the main compartment not taper so much at the end, to create a little more volume within the pack. The shoe compartment is a good addition. One other piece is when the pack is full, it does make it difficult to slip a water bottle in.
review.name: Great Backpack with Plenty of Space

review.reviewBody:
I have been using this bag fairly consistently over the past month, including an extended overseas trip to Asia.  This bag holds tons of stuff, including everything I needed for a 20 hour flight (bag fit perfectly under the seat and in the overhead), lots of organizational pockets and was easy to access everything.  While in Asia, this bag was caught in some fairly heavy rainstorms and kept the contents dry.  

The ergonomics of the bag are wonderful.  Despite my bag weighing a lot, it sat comfortably on my shoulders and I didn't feel the same shoulder fatigue I do with other bags of this size and weight.  Despite it being a larger bag, it maintains a slim, professional profile and fits in well for daily carry work purposes.
review.name: Lots of space, comfortable and great quality

review.reviewBody:
I was drawn to this pack, because it is recyclable and I have tended to like what NEMO has produced over the years. I have only used it for about a week and on one flight, so my experience isn't exhaustive. 
I was surprised by how large the vertical zipper pocket is. I found it somewhat challenging to keep items organized in that pocket and discovered items can disappear in there. I have yet to find a use for the zipper pockets contained therein, though I suspect I will. I like pockets.
I love the very deep stretch mesh pockets for my water bottle or a wind breaker or a snack. I have yet to try a fatter water bottle, so the pockets may not work for everyone. These sorts of pockets on a panel loading pack don't always work well. I find that these do.
I do not yet now how well the pack will handle rain/snow, but I am tempted to stash a small pack cover in the zippered bottom compartment. This compartment intrigues, me but like a few of the other nooks and crannies I have yet to figure out how best to use it.
The two shortcomings for me are the price and the lack of a single, large compartment. I find the price a bit steep, but you are getting a pack with a lot of features and I am willing to pay more for something I know can/will be recycled. The vertical zippered pocket is large, but there will certainly be 30L packs that can carry more stuff. The price you pay for all the organizational features is a diminished carrying capacity and a limit to the size of any one item you can carry.
Overall, I like it and suspect it will become my EDC backpack.
review.name: All about the organization

review.reviewBody: I bought this several months ago, and am very pleased with it. I use it as my work/flight bag. I carry my laptop, iPad, headset and everything else I need for the office and to power everything. Keep a change of cloths and shoes in it as well. Tons of room for everything I need and well organized. The security pocket perfectly fits a large cellphone or g19 as well which I was happy about. Wouldn’t hesitate to buy this bag again.
review.name: Great everyday bag!

review.reviewBody: The bag is noticeably high quality form the stitching to the zippers and fabric. The organizational structure takes a bit to get used to with the main vertical zip. It lends itself to be used almost like a duffel. I wish there was perhaps one more tech compartment, but this is a small gripe. Overall, very satisfied.
review.name: High quality construction

name: Vantage Endless Promise 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Awesome bibs wish they were just a little longer but im 6’4”, 230 lbs and wearing size large so 🤷🏾‍♂️

review.reviewBody: I needed something very warm for the winter in Vermont. I’ve been buying Cotopaxi stuff for a while now, but this overall takes the cake. It’s very comfy and warm. I got a lot of compliments the day I wore it out.

review.reviewBody: Fit and finish is Cotopaxi standard. Super comfy and warm. Though more colors would be awesome. Only gripe is the small zipper for the chest pocket which is difficult for those who may be disabled or have tactile issues as the zipper is tiny and not easy to pull open one handed. Overall happy and would recommend
review.name: Great concept, and solid product

review.reviewBody: I have the same bars on my Toyota 4runner and have never had issues. The shape of the 22 Acura MDX for some reason creates a sound that you can't stop. I've tried everything and spent hours online looking for support and there is no way to fix the sound
review.name: Acura MDX shoppers find something else

review.reviewBody:
PLEASE READ:
If you have a sunroof and plan to use it DO NOT GET THIS MODEL. As many reviews state, the whistle will drive you insane. I have an Audi Q7 which is known to be extremely quiet in the cabin, but this whistle can even be heard when the roof is closed. I read the reviews prior to purchasing and thought that it must be user installation error… nope.
review.name: Great BUT the WHISTLING!

review.reviewBody: Fit my 2024 Ford Maverick perfectly. Works great for hauling my SUP around to various surf sports and best of all me wind noise like to old square bar style I had.
review.name: Awesome product

review.reviewBody:
Pro: it was easy to install, and fit the car well.

Con:  there's a lot more wind noise than I expected.
review.name: easy to install

review.reviewBody: Looks great and definitely adds that sporty look. Works great with my bike mount and whatever other large items I need to transport.
review.name: Looks Great

review.reviewBody: Looks nice and of great quality. The only issue was that they didn't have the measures to put the rack on the roof of a 2023 ford F150 but that was easy to fix.
review.name: Nice rack

review.reviewBody: I was sad to see my last set go with my crashed car. I bought the same ones but different length.
review.name: Great crossbar. Second set I’ve bought.

review.reviewBody: The overall rack is great quality and fits perfectly. No complaints there, but for how expensive the rack system is it should include the locking mechanism and keys. Having to purchase those separately for additional money is just not right. So, if it would include those I would give it 5 stars no problem.
review.name: Great quality racks but needs to include keys.

review.reviewBody: I bought this about 5 months ago, and it has held up amazingly. I followed all of the instructions to set up and they were very clear. I have used them to put surfboards on my roof and strap them, and they were very secure. Now I have my ski box on and they are still working perfectly! Every once in a while I will check to make sure they are torqued properly but have never had any issues. They look good, are easy to use and install, very sturdy, and overall a great purchase!
review.name: Great Purchase

description: Buy the Castelli Undersaddle Mini Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Undersaddle Mini Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Undersaddle Mini Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
In terms of size and looks, this bag is great. While riding it doesn't sway at all and I've never had an issue with the bag falling off or coming loose mid-ride (after about 3k miles of riding with it). 

When riding in wet conditions however the contents of my bag also get wet (and rust). This wasn't the case with my Topeak bag which had thicker material. The zipper is also very clumsy and I have trouble closing it even when it's not very full. If you ride a lot in wet/snowy conditions, I wouldn't recommend.
review.name: Doesn't hold up to wet conditions well

review.reviewBody: Yes, this is a small bag (it's called Mini), but it holds the necessities: tube, CO2, tire levers, mini tools. The bag fits snugly beneath the seat, with no swinging. Love it!
review.name: Perfect for the Essentials

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Bikepack Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dragonfly OSMO Bikepack Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Bikepack Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Brought for bike packing explicitly and the tent is not only light but well spaced with attention to details which make it a 5/5.  The external gear stash for shoes, phone and light holders plus the hooks for helmets make it so useable. Also it packs well to suit handlebar mounting with little effort packing or unpacking.
review.name: Lightweight, great features

review.reviewBody: I'm a huge fan of Nemo and have been using their gear for years now. This has replaced the Hornet 2p in my backpacking setup for 2 reasons: it is freestanding - which is massively important when it comes to pitching a tent in the hardscape of the desert. And 2, it has more interior room and I often share this tent with my partner. Yes, it is a bit heavier than the Hornet as well as many tents in the same category, but I think that trade-off is absolutely worth it.
review.name: Amazing Tent For Arizona Adventures

review.reviewBody: Nemo has done a great job combining light weight, durable and accessorized.  I chose the tent for it being a sub 3 lb 2p tent. I use it solo bike touring/packing and like the extra space, that said I am 6 ft 200lbs and would call this tent 1.5 p, two persons will fit without much extra space. The light weight design can be a little scary in wind and bad weather but with the fly stacked out in just four spots it pulls down on the tent poles and creates a tight secure system. I am not typically a fan of accessories as they are usually not that useful and provide an additional fail point, but this tent has several extras I am really pleased with the best being the "Landing Zone" I thought it was a gimmick but found it to be worth the extra weight. There is a lot more to this tent go check it out!
review.name: Details

review.reviewBody: This tent has come with me on thru hikes and many bikepacking adventures. It is small (still roomy enough for two people and a small dog on the Colorado Trail), lightweight and packable and the new OSMO fabric performs really well! Even in super wet and humid environments, it stretches far less than traditional tent fabrics when wet. I also really like that NEMO has given this tent a muted color scheme. It helps you blend in and stay more discreet on those unplanned stops. The shorter pole segments also fit really nicely in a backpacking backpack too so everything stays protected and together. An absolute no brainer of a tent!
review.name: not only for bikepacking -GREAT TENT

review.reviewBody: NEMO reimagined their super rad backpacking tents for bike packing and I am here for it.  Love the thoughtful updates - size and shape of the stuff stack, shorter tent poles, attachment points for tent to bike, daisy chain for gear, and storage bin under vestibule.  The new OSMO fabric is strong, water resistant, and has less stretch than other tents I have used.  Don't sleep on this one.
review.name: Thoughtful Bike Design

review.reviewBody: The color is fantastic, we appreciate NEMO knowing bikepackers don't always want to be seen... This is similar to the original Dragonfly, but has smaller pole segments and sack so it can easily be attached to the handlebars of your bike. The OSMO fabric is game changer. This tent is super lightweight and so easy to put together.
review.name: Killer Bikepacking Tent

name: Dragonfly OSMO Bikepack Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: Enduro Elite Flat Front Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Tutto Nano Tight - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Tutto Nano Tight - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these tights. They are warm and fit well, chamois is fine. I ride in all weather. 100 miles a week. 122 lbs, 5´7”, thin build- purchased a small.
review.name: Great fit and warm

review.reviewBody: I have worn castelli in the past and have found the products to be pretty comfortable and they make a great chamois. Ultimately I decided not to keep these pants for two reasons. 1. I am now between sizes for castelli and wasn't sure going to small from a medium would fit my larger thighs, but the medium waist band was too big and when I bent over it slid down. 2. My last pair few pairs of castelli shorts and pants have shown more wear and tear on the seems around the chamois and inner thigh compared to other brands of stuff I have. So I returned these and kept the Giodana silver line tights instead.
review.name: Sizing is off

review.reviewBody:
I am quite impressed with these.  They fit great and I am only 5'2".  I do have to pull up the excess length when I first put them on, but it works fine.  I had a pair from Garneu and I loved them, but they have articulated knees and since my legs are short, the articulated knees would sag below my knees.  LOL  So these work better because they are more like tights instead of pants.  I am very muscular and thick, not skinny.  XL is the size I purchased, but I could have gotten by with a Large.  I am hoping they don't stretch.  I just wash them (NO FABRIC SOFTENER) and lay them out to dry.  

I have worn them in the rain and it does not soak through which is wonderful.  I ride in all weather conditions and although they are listed for temps as low as 39, if you are cold natured, I would not recommend that cold.  I am a warm natured person, and my thighs got pretty cold at 34 degrees.  I made it work and it was fine, but any colder and it would not work for more than a hour outside.  

For cold and rain, they are perfect and I highly recommend.
review.name: Impressed with these

review.reviewBody: I bought this in a medium as my other castelli cycling pants ran somewhat small, and medium was perfect. Nice fit and material, seems like it will offer more warmth and weather protection than another pair I purchased, and I like the reflective bands at the bottom.
review.name: Great cycling pants

review.reviewBody: Works well from 35-55 degrees F. Great fit and feel. I prefer tights to bib tights so I'm very satisfied with these. The usual Castelli high quality.
review.name: Perfect tights

name: Tutto Nano Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody: They run a little big. They only had cargo pockets not regular pockets. I think I just need to get used to them. 686 has great stuff
review.name: They run a little big.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First time with the product and love it. The inside pants is perfect after a day of riding
review.name: Smarty bibs

review.reviewBody: This bib is absolutely amazing! I love how warm it is! The vents and removable layers will make it easy to wear no matter the temperature.
review.name: This bib is absolutely amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Attire was great with great optimal base to layer some more clothes on there. The additional 3 in 1 comes in clutch on those cold night for all day to night riding . I can’t get over how many pockets this bib has!
review.name: Must have

review.reviewBody: Great value! Sizes run true, room enough to layer but not super baggy. Fabric seems bomber and they're nice and waterproof on storm days. Cargo pockets are handy. I like these pants enough I bought two colors.
review.name: Solid pants, great value!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing pants just don’t like how you’d have to tuck in your shirt/hoodie into the sweatpants if the sweat pants were zipped to the pants
review.name: Amazing pants just don’t like

review.reviewBody: Snow boarding in storm conditions for 3 days in Utah no problem for my smarty 3 in 1. Stayed warm the whole time.
review.name: 686 the right gear is a must.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm without the liner, very warm with the liner. Recommend removing liner unless the temp is below 0 F.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: Great pant. Runs a little baggie if you’re into that. The versatility of the liner is great on colder days. Ventilation zippers are awesome to keep you cooler on your thighs. The zipper pockets are easy to open and close. Not the biggest fan of the Velcro enclosures especially with mittens on, water proofing is great and wetter days the water just runs right off.
review.name: Versatile pant for colder to not as cold days.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very pleased with this combo set. Wasn’t sure if I’d like it, but wanted to test it out based on positive reviews. Has a nice look and great quality material, but does feel a little bulky, but not cumbersome. I ride comfortably in them, but I prefer the slimmest clothing on the slopes. Bib design won me over for sure and they’ll last many years which adds to the value.
review.name: Very pleased with this combo

name: Smarty 3-In-1 Cargo Bib Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Coleman Sportflex Soft Cooler - 42 Can online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sportflex Soft Cooler - 42 Can
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Sportflex Soft Cooler - 42 Can online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For the price, I expected bigger and better. The wheels and telescopic handle are rugged enough. I don't like the flap on top, wish it was a solid top, with a large, zippered pocket on top instead. The rest of the features were okay. We had a much cheaper one bought elsewhere, was the perfect size, loved all the features, but the wheels and handle were not rugged at all.
review.name: Too pricey
comment:
Hello!

Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear the cooler didn't live up to your expectations.  Your feedback is highly appreciated and valued by the business, and we will make sure that your insights are shared.

Please contact us directly through our Contact Us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.reviewBody: Bought as a gift for my parents who travel often. The size was perfect, as well as access to the cooler, and the rolling feature. The cooler got rave reviews!
review.name: Great for travel!

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for the "perfect" cooler for our grandson's many baseball games. This is exactly what we needed!
review.name: Perfect Size!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great soft cooler. It rolls with ease and gas extension handle as well as side handles for carrying. The top has a velcro access panel for quick grabs but also zips all the way open. Great for a quick day trip or picnic or day down at the softball fields for drinks. Really enjoy having this.
review.name: Awesome for traveling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this for a beach trip and it was very easy to carry with the wheels. It was also light weight and the perfect size for a family to add all our cold drinks and food. My one complaint is that it very easily leaked during use
review.name: Easy to carry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have never had a soft cover cooler of this size and I wasn’t sure how it would keep things cold but it definitely did not disappoint. It fit so much better in my car and worked so much better for our family adventures. Having wheels and so much space makes it so convenient and easy to use and it doesn’t weigh much when empty making it easier to store when not being used. Great cooler and nice color.
review.name: Very convenient and roomy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this Sportflex 42 can Soft Cooler on wheels and discovered I no longer need a hard bulky plastic cooler to drag on trips or to the beach!  It is so attractive and has so many pockets to add additional necessities but is so easy to travel with since it is on wheels.  It kept my cans nice and cool and  was attractive while doing so. A lot of people asked me where I got it!  Great product!  Highly recommend!
review.name: Sportflex Soft Cooler is totally fun!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this Sportflex cooler to use as my weekend cooler and weekday lunch box. This cooler is packed full of great features. It has a nice telescoping handle and pulls very nice. The cooler is sturdy when it's loaded. I love the top insulated grab hole - that is so cool!! you can pull an item out without having to unzip the whole top and letting your cool air out. Fantastic!!!
review.name: great design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great cooler.  It is lightweight and so easy to maneuver.  You can take this anywhere.  The handle is so nice.  You can put it down and packs easily into my car. It looks small but I am amazed how much I can pack into it and still have room for ice.  The pockets on the side are great to put smaller items that you need to take along.  The cooler has a very sturdy and strong base, zipper and wheels that will last a long time.
review.name: Great Go to Cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cooler is great.  It keeps ice for hours keeping your drinks cool.  It has easy access through an opening on the top to reach in and get your drone or whatever you are needing out if the cooler.  It is very lightweight and durable. Due to the fact that it is on wheels it is so easy to take wherever you are going.  Love it!
review.name: Awesome Cooler!

name: Sportflex Soft Cooler - 42 Can

review.reviewBody: I was riding with my road helmet (specialized air-net) until I was able to snag this helmet. Now, only my lack of  skills let people know I’m out of place! Truly though, this breathes very well for my slower MTB pace and is comfortable on the head. Locks up nice and secure, sweat band does it’s job, and my longer hair doesn’t get caught in the mips.
review.name: Comfortable helmet

review.reviewBody: My third engage MIPs helmet … hit a low hanging limb with the first one - got a little whiplash but the helmet worked great and my head was fine. It’s the most comfortable helmet I’ve used … lots of venting and overall great fit. Love the colorway options too!
review.name: The Best!

review.reviewBody: Love the adjustable visor and the ease with which you can alter the sizing! This makes it practical to use the same helmet year-round - whether you're wearing a thick beanie in January or just a buff in July.
review.name: Worth the price!

review.reviewBody: J'ai chuter lourdement avec mon vélo et me suis retrouvé à l'hôpital pour quelques jours. J'ai subi un bonne commotion cérébrale et compris que mon casque m'a sauver la vie. je m'en suis acheté un autre identique. Hâte de reprendre la route dans un mois avec mon nouveau casque!
review.name: Vie sauve

review.reviewBody: Head on collision with a bike. Head first in to the bike frame.
review.name: Saved my life

review.reviewBody: From first try on, it fit just right, is comfortable, easy to adjust and light weight. Can’t wait to ride.
I like everything about this helmet except I cannot center n=my headlamp on it. It has to sit to the side. This is due to the ventilation.
review.name: I like everything about this

review.reviewBody: The helmet fits incredibly well, with a good amount of adjustability. Was able to find coloring that matched that of my mountain bike. Overall has great features with comfort and is lightweight to boot.
review.name: The helmet fits incredibly well,

review.reviewBody: Well this never happens, I did question the email with the wrong helmet but just passed it off, then you fixed it with this one so I wanted to say that I love this helmet. Hopefully I never have to use the safety features you provide, but so far so good. Love the fit the look and the visor!
review.name: Well this never happens, I

review.reviewBody: Comfy light weight and the adjustable visor is great.
review.name: Awesome

name: Engage Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I just ordered 3 pairs of overalls and these by far are the best fitting.  They don’t have the awkward gaps at the side or back.  The fabric is substantial.  The pockets are deep.  I love the zippered leg pocket.
review.name: The best fit, no gaps.

review.reviewBody: Amazing overalls with so many great features. I especially appreciate the snaps on the bib pockets so nothing falls out of them when I take them off. I usually wear a 14 at old navy and a 36/32 in dockers men’s pants. I got a 14/32 in the heathered black denim and they fit relatively loosely all over. I kind of wish I had sized down but they’re still wonderful overalls.
review.name: Pretty much perfect

review.reviewBody: I really love these overalls. The fit is absolutely perfect. I tried on a bunch of different pairs to find the right fit, and these win hands down! If you’re unsure, definitely try them on. Also, you can’t beat the pockets. I’m 5’7”, 130lbs, 27” waist and the 4x32 was perfect.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: The Freshly is my favorite overall, perfect for getting work done or just running errands around town. These are super durable and the fit is true to size and flattering. I love having all the extra pockets when working in the garden. Dovetail really takes into consideration fit and function in workwear made specifically for women!
review.name: My Favorite Overall

review.reviewBody: I love these overalls, they are my go to for any house project, yard project, camp trip. They are super comfortable, functional, and they look good too. All the pockets make it easy while you're working on something to store a tool, phone, paintbrush, etc. Every lady needs a pair of these.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: These are seriously the best overalls for women ever!! So comfortable and stretchy! Already broken in for you! I?m usually a size 10 in jeans and I got the 12 because I just wanted them to comfy and they are perfect! The 10s fit me too but they were definitely more snug. So if you want a more slacked out fit maybe size up. Highly recommend! You won?t regret it!
review.name: Love them so much!

review.reviewBody: I love my Freshly overalls - they fit great, are comfortable and are super durable! I've put these overalls to the test and they've held up great without stretching out or becoming over-worn. They also have all the pockets a girl could ask for, and then some! The placement of the pockets seems well thought out and super functional. Will definitely be buying another pair in a different color.
review.name: The Perfect Overall - Fit & Function!

name: Freshley Overall - Women's

review.reviewBody:
They feel like you aren't wearing anything, which is the highest praise. 100% freedom of movement. 
- no pockets (only the one thigh zip) 
- major crotch drop for hitting the splits in the alpine 
- no wetting out even in a full waterfall
- uber thin but abrasion resistant 
- size the same as you would for shorts (they stretch very nicely at the waist and cuffs) 

These are the best pants ever made, read colin's full review on skagitalpinism for all the deets.
review.name: The Long awaited Ninja Pants.

review.reviewBody: Bought the Bushwhaker 2vi to replace a Sweet Protection Trailblazer that did what it was supposed to do and protected my noggin in a wreck!
review.name: Mips Did Its Job!

review.reviewBody: This helmet is one of the safest you can buy. Look up the Virginia tech helmet ratings. Looks pretty good and has some good features. Haven't crashed on it but it's super comfy.
review.name: Super safety

review.reviewBody: I just got my Bushwhacker and the initial impression after a ride is that this helmet is phenomenal. One of the first things I noticed was how detailed the styling is. No doubt one of the best looking half-shells on the market. Incredible airflow with this helmet and just superb fit overall. Color selection is awesome - I personally went with the Woodland and it looks even better in person. Only thing holding this back from 5 stars is the visor - wish it had one setting lower, but the construction and adjustment system of the visor is high quality. This helmet really has all the latest tech fit into one helmet. Highly recommend this helmet if you are in the market for a new lid.
review.name: My new favorite Lid

name: Bushwhacker 2VI Mips Helmet
