review.reviewBody: Terrible fit and very awkward if you like to have your ability to move freely on the bike.
review.name: To bulky

review.reviewBody: Fit was true ,just a great all in one safe protection for the upper body
review.name: Very breathable

review.reviewBody: I was at the bike park and took a mean fall after sending a jump. I rolled a good 10 feet on rocks but walked away  with only minor scraps. This thing is a beast.
review.name: Crash Tested

review.reviewBody: I was very rusty after not riding for close to a year.  Went out last weekend and the ride took us through some snow and then rocky terrain with the occasional downed trees.  I just described the objects that I fell on all at generally slow speeds.  Excellent forearm protection and the gear is easy to remove after working up a sweat.
review.name: As advertised

review.reviewBody:
Pretty comfortable though isn't the softest directly against skin especially against chest hair. 

Getting to the point, I had a very heavy moto crash (broken pelvis, hand, double dislocated shoulders) in this and everything it covered was ok. My chest and ribs were sore from the hit but the pads took up a bunch of the impact so nothing broke. Also had several trips onto my shoulders and back before that wreck where I just popped back up and was totally fine.

Even as great as it helps it's quite bulky so I save it for bike park days when it's not too hot and run lighter protection on hot days or anytime I'm going to be doing any amount of pedaling. I also recommend bringing it into the shower after every use to keep the stink down as it can get pretty funky. If you want maximum protection that's not a hard shell and is pretty comfortable this is your best choice IMO.
review.name: Tested with heavy crash

review.reviewBody: Provides protection down to your belly which is essential if you end up mixing with your bike while casing jumps.  I could not find any other protection that would protect the area around your spleen, which is a popular place for mountain bikers to become internally injured after a spill.  This should probably be a five rating but the shirt does end up stinky, it takes some time to dry it out after a good day riding, and it gets super hot when it?s over 80.
review.name: Works

review.reviewBody: Very well build top-  the elbow pads are actually built-in hard pads!!  Comfortable and fits well under a jersey.  Would recommend.
review.name: great coverage!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and not to hot... took rough crash shortly after getting this and it did it’s job, held up perfect
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
This item is exactly what the description says it is, an all in one protective shirt. It was a bit tricky climbing into it the first time and a little snug coming off but I thought it was a good way to have all of your protection in one unit. I would recommend wearing a cooling layer under it to make it easier to get it off when you are sweaty. I usually wear medium shirts, but tend to be right in the middle of a medium and a large. I would recommend going on the larger side if this is the case for you.
I did actually end up going with a Leatt Hydra protective pack instead because it was more suited for what I wanted.
review.name: All In One

review.reviewBody: Awesome
review.name: Awesome

name: 7855 Heavyweight Long-Sleeve Protection Shirt

I tried another brand’s sweater on in a store to compare as it was much cheaper, but it looked cheaper too…it looked like I was wearing a garbage bag in comparison. Fjallraven’s sits so nicely, and I’ll definitely be getting another colour of this style. Maybe the price will put people off, but you are buying quality.

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. More toe room than my last brand. Highly recommend!
review.name: Love this shoe!

review.reviewBody: I love the height of the toe box and the upper material, but, I would like it if someone at Altra could explain how they determine the toe box size. These "originals" are narrower than my "standard" Torin 7s.
review.name: Not as wide as I would like

review.reviewBody: I've spent the summer trying everything to alleviate my sudden plantar fasciitis from orthotics to Hokas and several other brands recommended by lots of sympathetic folks. I do have weird feet. High arch and instep, wide toes somewhat narrow heel, and supinating gate. Until I got these Altra Egos, it felt like walking around with a thumbtack in my heel. Now finally relief! So grateful to the clerk at Tradehome that said - "just try these"! I thought the wide toe box was ugly- but my teen age grandkids LOVED them! The colors are great. Turns out that zero drop was exactly what I needed to heal my heel, while the extra cushioning helped me be able to start really moving again. I recommend them to everyone who's tried everything else and to everyone who doesn't want to have to try again and again to help the foot pain go away. ( wish they cost less- I'd have them in every color) Thanks again to that clerk with upside down name tag. And thanks Altra for understanding feet.
review.name: Perfect for helping my plantar fasciitis heal.

review.reviewBody: Love this show! When are you going to bring the pink and blurple colors back? The pink is the best!
review.name: I am going to buy more

review.reviewBody: Really narrow In mid foot. They fit very different from other altras I've owned. I'm hoping this isn't a new standard because Altra shoes have always been best for my feet :(
review.name: way too narrow

review.reviewBody: I am not a fan of the look of the shoe on my foot whatsoever....but it is extremely comfortable for running and feels like it really absorbs shock well.
review.name: Extremely comfortable and impact absorbing

review.reviewBody: I've had two surgeries in the last year on my feet. I LOVE my HOKAs and thought these would give me some alternative options. I paid $170 and was very disappointed. Not sure I'd try again.
review.name: Wouldn't recommend if you have feet tenderness

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes last fall and have just put them into consistent use since May. I have put between 200-300 miles on them walking and the liners have holes in both heels. I had fusion surgery for a rigid hallux in March and these were just what I needed to accommodate my swollen foot as I resumed normal activities. The cushioning has also been appreciated as I bring my walking distances back up (20 - 30 miles/week). However, with the liner going to pieces in both shoes they will not last much longer. I'm quite disappointed.
review.name: Liner is falling apart

review.reviewBody: Two years ago I received total reconstruction surgery on my right foot and they recommended brand H, but by standing for a long time, working for more than eight hours, it reaches a point where I get tired and my foot starts to hurt. So I'm looking for recommendation and comfort. You recommend this type of tennis Shoes?
review.name: Looking for recommendations

review.reviewBody: These did not work for me at all. I wore them 2-3 times, and they ended up really hurting my knees-- I had to switch shoes a week before a race I was training for.. bummed.
review.name: Beware if you have bad knees!

review.reviewBody: Love these, 100% merino, I use them instead of a durag to protect my hurr. Seriously, I sleep in them and they make comfy sleep masks for daytime/outside napping. I also do all sorts of handy work, running, biking, kayaking, always keeping them on me, whether the weather is frightful or delightful. I seriously don’t wear anything else on my head. Hot or cold.

I will sometimes wear a buff on my head but I have a lot of hair and the regular buff is a little constricting, this one is not so constricting. Feels great on my neck and just enough warmth here on 40 degree, windy days.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Primus OmniFuel Stove + ErgoPump & Fuel Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I just returned from an eight day trip when I use this stove twice a day. Not only did I use it to boil water but also used it for cooking. The reason I purchased it was to have a multi fuel option just for the fun of it. I?ve been using canister stoves for the last several years which are quite easy and convenient. I just wanted to try something different. I wasn?t concerned about weight as I was traveling via motorcycle. We still camped every night and prepared delicious meals nightly.

What I was hoping for, and what impressed me the most was the ability to use this on low heat. It is very easy to adjust the heat and simmer when needed.
If I was backpacking, I probably wouldn?t carry a multi fuel stove as I mostly go with freeze dried food. When traveling by car or motorcycle, this is a great option. Besides, I don?t have to purchase canisters and then chuck them into the landfill. Safe travels!!
review.name: Multifuel

name: OmniFuel Stove + ErgoPump & Fuel Bottle

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of these shoes. The first (pictured on right) are from 2019 and have countless days on them with now the 3rd set of cleats. They are still going strong, just a little small with thicker socks. 
The “new” pair (pictured on the left) have less than 300 miles of riding and less the 5 miles of walking on them as they were just worn for a trip from Durango to Moab. Already the sole is delaminating on the medial aspects throughout the area of the cleat recess. There is other evidence of inferior rubber used in the sole based additional cracking and deterioration on both shoes. Very disappointing! Especially given that the shoe really has no other shortcomings. It fits well, breathes well, and stays secure with the velcro stamp. As with everything post pandemic, quality control could use a little help at Giro nowadays.
review.name: Not what they once were!

review.reviewBody: I want to start saying buying shoes online is always a gamble.  But this shoe combines a stiff sole and a sloppy upper that has the foot trying to find some level of comfort somewhere in the shoe.  It is a combination to terrible feature with the added annoyance of a large toe area that you can't get snug, laces that are too long, a stiff and uncomfortable strap and mushy upper.  It tries to be everything and succeeds in doing everything horribly. I don't think this shoe would work for anyone that has ever had a good cycling shoe on their feet.  Given the brand I trusted the pedigree but this is a strong do not buy.
review.name: Sorry to say a terrible shoe

review.reviewBody: Laces started fraying immediately. Returned, and backcountry never refunded. So steer well clear of these, and perhaps backcountry and competitive cyclist. :(
review.name: Super poor lace design

review.reviewBody: 2nd pair of these, great for DH, enduro and long hike a bike backcountry adventures
review.name: My fav

review.reviewBody: They fit my super wide feet and are comfortable and stiff enough for an all day pedal.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Knew it as soon as I slipped the first one on that they were the winner of the three shoes I had ordered.  Gwin Blk/Wh size 44.  Super comfortable.  Well made.  True to size.  Stylin'.  My wife even liked the look of them!  I would buy another pair today if they had my size in another color.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: the quality of both sneakers and pants are very low. very disappointed about it. doesn't look like original
review.name: bad

review.reviewBody: Looking for a new balance shoe that would work well with Manual transmission driving. This show I purchased at size 8.5. I also have a pair of 577's that is also in 8.5. I also tried New Balance Store shoes and their common 574 model is also fitted to me at 8.5. I have tried the instore shoes at 8, but it was a bit tight with my big toe towards the end. The most important part of this shoe to me is that it is ""FLAT"", as opposed to the 574's normal ""heel to toe drop"". Being flat allows me to gauge my ankle movement better while operating Vehicle pedals. They work good for what I wanted them for. The only complaint I have is that the toe box may be more narrow than the common 574's, my left foot feels like it could have bunionette redness at times. I make sure I don't lace my shoe too tightly because of it. I think from reading the reviews of many New Balance Shoes, they really need to focus on making Toe Box Wider for comfort, foot health, and also allows more people to actually fit in their products.
review.name: Bought for Driving /operating driving pedals

review.reviewBody: Love these kicks. Second pair, different color. Were delivered fast and fit as described. Will likely buy a 3rd pair while they're still available.
review.name: Love these kicks. Second pair!

review.reviewBody: I had a broken foot, and would hope these 574s would have the same support as compared to other 574s.  While they are comfortable compared to other shoes out there, there was a slight discomfort perhaps on how flat it was or sole padding.  Slightly less grip, so if there's something slippery on the floor, brace yourself.
review.name: Great shoes for the avrage

review.reviewBody: Great design and just what I've been looking for, but once I put them on they were just too tight all around.  Ordered my normal size thinking that would be fine, but way too tight around the sides and toe.  Went to reorder, a size up to see if that helps from the website to see that, they were now sold out and found them from a third party that I'm still waiting on to see how they fit.  I have a fairly thin foot for the regular sizes and still were too tight.  After realizing what was wrong I looked over the reviews and seen it was a common theme since these are unisex instead of mens only.  I feel as though that part of the description should be a little bolder because I completely overlooked it when purchasing the first pair that were too small in my normal size.
review.name: Too tight

review.reviewBody: good quality seems to run large as compared to other 574 models, not much in the way of ankle support cut low on the sides. I purchased online might be better to try this one on in store first.
review.name: good quality

review.reviewBody: Best pair of shoes I've bought in a while. Definitely will be worn quite a bit
review.name: New Favorite

review.name: Small 43 size

review.reviewBody: Functionally great. Cool, protects from sun, keeps shape after squishing and stowing. Why does it have to be clown colors only? Make a black one.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wicked light, wicked fast drying, wicked sick look. Love the fit, doesn't make my head look weird, and is very comfortable to wear, even when it gets hot and sweaty up there. This hat has the benefits of a trucker style hat (mesh back) without looking like a trucker hat (personally I look terrible in those). Loved it so much that when I lost it I immediately ordered another. Really is just a solid hat.

review.reviewBody: This bag has some good qualities. It’s comfortable to wear, has plenty of space, and is thoughtful with pockets and space utilization. However, its massive design flaw is that when you place it on the ground, it cannot sit upright without being propped up against something (and even then needs a steep angle to hold itself up. When placed on the ground without support, it rolls forward onto the front part of the bag (shoulder straps up) and lays there like a toddler throwing a tantrum. This makes retrieving anything from it when it’s on the ground properly frustrating. Avoid this bag if you want a bag that can sit upright when you aren’t holding it in place.
review.name: Design flaw

review.reviewBody: thank you, I received the backpack. the quality is excellent.
review.name: Super

review.reviewBody: Bought this to use for work and it surpassed my expectations. Very easy to find everything.
review.name: Great spaces!

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a combination of travel and work. It’s perfect for both. I love that my Yeti water bottle fits on the side and has a strap to secure it. All the pockets are as advertised and I’m impressed how much I can fit in it. When it’s packed as heavy as possible it still doesn’t strain my shoulders. I wasn’t sure about the colour but am super happy I picked the blue, as it’s still professional for work settings but a bit nicer than standard black. Great purchase.
review.name: Exactly what it says it was

review.reviewBody:
This is a great quality product, it fits really comfortably on my back.

review.reviewBody: My husband loves these! Was a Christmas present for him for a cool cycling theme this year. We had to send the first pair back and get XL, as they run really small... review.reviewBody:
Perfect tight for temperatures in the 40's. Very nice light fleece lining that I didn't expect but was really glad to see. I'm 5'8" so they are a bit long in the leg but there's no law against cuffing. Castelli shorts and these leggings as well fit REALLY SMALL so I end up ordering not one but two sizes larger and I get a really good fit. I've got a 38' waist and I ordered a XXL.
Another nice aspect is Castelli makes gear that really looks good too.
review.name: Righty Tighties

review.reviewBody: I'm so happy I picked up this color in Midnight Mauve which as of right now is sold out in all sizes. It is such a beautiful color in this jacket. I thought it would be too dark but it is just beautiful. It's a nice mauve color, lighter than the color Black Currant from last season. If you have any pieces in that color it will match perfectly with this Midnight Mauve as it is in the same complementary color family. As usual, I sized up one size because I actually like to wear my jacket as a jacket over layers and because North Face still cuts the armpits on ladies jackets way too high and narrow. The dual bungee cords on the left and the right side are gone in this current version, so you cannot equally adjust the jacket from left to right, but there is one bungee cord on the right side of the inside of the jacket to tighten it at the hem if you need to keep cold air out or if you just want a slimmer look. On the plus side there is a zippered inside pocket on the left chest and it has a loop, you can hook your key lanyard on to it (see close up photo). This is such a great idea and I really like when jackets have this loop as nothing is worse than reaching for your keys and dropping them in snow. If they're hooked onto the loop inside your jacket, you know you can just pull your keys out without releasing it from the lanyard and you won't lose your keys in the snow or out in the wilderness. It's a little thing but it's a smart thing to put in jackets. I do miss the embroidered North Face logo. This version of theThermoball jacket has a heat transferred iron-on of TNF logo. I do miss that and I hope they bring it back as I don't know how well this decal will last. If it's a cost-saving thing, maybe North Face can just do the embroidered logo on the front of the jacket and forgo the back of the jacket. But overall, this jacket's beautiful and I'm so glad I decided to pick up this season's version.
review.name: Thermoball Eco - Fall 2024 - Midnight Mauve

review.reviewBody: I am loving the color the versatility of the jacket the many ways to use as is or a layering piece! I made a great choice!
review.name: I definitely would buy again.

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this jacket, the color (olive green) and the fit. I bought it for the in-between seasons and it keeps me warm without being bulky. The fit is nice enough that it is versatile

review.reviewBody: I like the "new" color. Good weight for winter cold without too much bulk.

review.reviewBody: This is a good quality jacket, and seems like it would be warm, but sadly I had to return it. It fit well everywhere but in the arms. They were a little too snug to allow for a sweater underneath so I had to return it.
review.name: Great looking jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace my Thermoball hoodie that I have had since 2014. This new version has the same great quality, but with thicker insulation without adding weight or feeling bulky. It keeps me warm and is roomy enough to wear layers if needed.
review.name: Second Thermoball Jacket in 10 years

review.reviewBody: Color is great, fit is good and it is warm enough for a Chicago fall.

review.reviewBody:
Love the hand out tech so much. 
however this mitt felt like it was insulated evenly all the way through. this always makes me feel like i'm losing dexterity and control for doing my bindings or trying to operate my action camera. would it be easy to unzip get my hand out and do whatever? 
sure. but i'd prefer to keep my digits warm inside the mitt when possible. 
materials feel Very nice. I did notice that i had to size down compared to dakine or crab grab mittens.
review.name: Love the hand out tech
